intro: Coronilla repanda var. montserratii, commonly known as the Montserrat coronilla, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces trifoliate leaves and is often found in mountainous regions, contributing to the local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain areas.
